alert.note: Alert for Hidalgo (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 21 at 5:26PM MDT until July 21 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Advisory for... West central Hidalgo County in southwestern New Mexico... * Until 700 PM MDT. * At 525 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust was over Lordsburg and Steins along I-10. HAZARD...Less than three miles visibility with strong winds up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists and NMDOT webcams. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 26. Locations impacted include... Steins, Lordsburg, Road Forks, Lordsburg Playa, Shakespeare and Pyramid Mountains. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
